meta.description: About the Department of Islamic Affairs in the Emirate of Sharjah

intro.title: Who We Are
intro.paragraph1: The Department of Islamic Affairs in the Emirate of Sharjah was established by Emiri Decree No. (27) of 2008, issued by His Highness Sheikh Dr. Sultan bin Muhammad Al Qasimi, Member of the Supreme Council and Ruler of the Emirate of Sharjah – may God protect him. Subsequently, Emiri Decree No. (2) of 2010 was issued regarding the organization of Islamic affairs in Sharjah, entrusting it with preaching, guidance, awareness, and the care of mosques in the emirate.
intro.paragraph2: The Department of Islamic Affairs in Sharjah strives to convey the call of Allah Almighty with wisdom and good counsel, to facilitate the performance of congregational prayer rituals in mosques, and to provide all services and facilities that enable the performance of this obligation in the best possible manner in a spiritual atmosphere.

vision.title: Vision
vision.content: Establishing the correct religious methodology and developing mosques to support national belonging and identity.

mission.title: Mission
mission.content: We work to strengthen Islamic values and principles in society by spreading the correct teachings of religion and caring for mosques.
